textBeforeTable: Additional costs: Manual Prerequisites: Must be LPN You will study the systems approach to patient safety related to medication safety, interdisciplinary team relationships and best nursing practices. You will study national and provincial organizations designed to facilitate the Canadian patient safety agenda. You will examine a regional risk management or quality improvement project focused on advancing patient safety. + Patient Safety (NRSG 252) CRN: 201503-584 Home Study (Print) $655.00 March 29, 2016 - June 17, 2016 Registration deadline: March 18, 2016 Register Now CRN: 201503-583 Home Study (Print) $655.00 January 11, 2016 - April 1, 2016 Registration deadline: December 31, 2015 Register Now CRN: 201501-65 Home Study (Print) $655.00 August 31, 2015 - November 20, 2015 Registration deadline: August 21, 2015 Register Now CRN Location Fee Start and End Dates Additional costs: Text(s) and print materials Prerequisites: Anatomy and Physiology 1 (Concurrent), Sociology 1, or taken concurrently. textAfterTable: Principles of Nursing Practice for Outpatient Procedures (NURS 1658) + You will review principles of nursing practice as they apply to procedures performed in a variety of outpatient settings. You will study process, roles/responsibilities, legal/moral obligations and measures to ensure patient and staff safety. This course will provide an introduction to the principles of asepsis, sterilization and disinfection and infection prevention in the outpatient setting. It will also provide information on identification, safe use and care of instruments, equipment and supplies for the performance of procedures. You will study pre and post procedure care including methods of anesthesia, recovery from anesthesia, discharge and follow up. For more information, browse the blankfrequently asked questions(pdf).
